storyInfo:
The youths compare the strange things that have been happening to them. All clues point to Dahuang's uninvited guest.
Ji and Shu begin a long conversation in front of the Shennong shrine.

attributes.content: Rice paddies as far as the eye can see, all ethereal. Heaven and earth are expansive, but all is silent.
The whiff of liquor, and the dancing clouds flow into a goblet.
Down the goblet, and all is clear and bright.
Mm... what a dream.
attributes.name: Ling

attributes.content: How did you find the time to come?
attributes.name: Shu

attributes.content: Aren't things pretty exciting over here? I wanted to see whether the kaoliang liquor you promised me was ready.
attributes.name: Ling

attributes.content: How do I give it do you in a dream?
attributes.name: Shu

attributes.content: What year's vintage are you talking about? Which dream of yours is this?
attributes.name: Shu

attributes.content: At least let me sniff a whiff, if I don't get to taste it in a dream.
attributes.name: Ling

attributes.content: Or see if my hardest-working sister got a little thinner.
attributes.name: Ling

attributes.content: This is what Nian has made?
attributes.name: Ling

attributes.content: The poet waves her sleeves, and a pot of wine and two goblets appear out of thin air.
She cracks the mud seal on the pot, and the rich scent of liquor fills the air.
The poet turns around and peers out at the rice fields that stretch for tens of thousands of li and beyond. The seasons circle overhead, winter giving way to summer, spring giving way to autumn.
Is this what you see in this 'heart'?
attributes.name: Ling

attributes.content: Rice fields as far as the eye can see, the seasons rotating. You farm here day after day. Is it really possible to build what you talk about here?
attributes.name: Ling

attributes.content: Do you need a hand?
attributes.name: Ling

attributes.content: I just don't want you to turn this whole vessel in to a huge pot of wine, or suddenly get all philosophical and think you would rather dream forever than to wake up in a world without freedom.
attributes.name: Shu

attributes.content: You sure you don't need my help? I've almost forgotten how many years you spent here. You're gonna become my aged liquor if you don't get out and get some fresh air.
attributes.name: Ling

attributes.content: For our other brothers and sisters, I worry that they don't see things clear enough. For you, I worry that you see too clearly.
attributes.name: Ling

attributes.content: See too clearly, such that you fail to see 'yourself'.
attributes.name: Ling

attributes.content: I'm just farming here.
attributes.name: Shu

attributes.content: Everything has a heart, from the mountains to the rivers, to the trees and to the grass. To you, the trees and grass may not be any different from our own lives.
attributes.name: Ling

attributes.content: What is it that you still can't put down? What keeps your mind occupied?
attributes.name: Ling

attributes.content: Jie left behind so many scrolls and books. She wanted to teach everyone to read and write. But all those scrolls and books disappeared with her. No one remembers her, other than us.
attributes.name: Shu

attributes.content: But I've visited schools and the Tianshi Bureaus, and I've seen handwriting that looked exactly like hers in their books.
attributes.name: Shu

attributes.content: All of her things are no more. Even I didn't manage to keep a single one. But the words she said are now being said by students, and the words that she wrote are now being written by the pens of students.
attributes.name: Shu

attributes.content: She once told me, 'It's the things I leave behind that count.'
attributes.name: Shu

attributes.content: I just want to see what I can leave behind on the far end of all these fields of rice. What I can leave behind if the day comes that I am no more.
attributes.name: Shu

attributes.content: Has the end that you have been staring at for so long changed at all?
attributes.name: Ling

attributes.content: Never. Nothing but snow as far as the eye could see.
attributes.name: Shu

attributes.content: The spring harvest, the autumn harvest, all buried in snow.
attributes.name: Shu

attributes.content: I see...
attributes.name: Ling

attributes.content: Do you feel disappointment at the result? Regret?
attributes.name: Ling

attributes.content: Is life itself not a result?
attributes.name: Shu

attributes.content: Do the countless mortals of the world give up living just because they realize it will eventually come to an end?
attributes.name: Shu

attributes.content: Not all our siblings think that way... has our little brother come back?
attributes.name: Ling

attributes.content: Yes.
attributes.name: Shu
Ling
attributes.content: Where has the timid and docile Ji we knew and loved gone?

attributes.name: Ling
attributes.content: Little brothers and sisters are always cuter when they stay little.
...I'll go to him.
attributes.name: Shu

attributes.content: One, two, three...
attributes.name: Grain Buds

attributes.content: What species is this, Megaphone? I've never seen it. It looks nice.
attributes.name: Grain Buds

attributes.content: You wouldn't understand if I explained. Just shut up and keep looking.
attributes.name: Annoyed Apprentice Tianshi

attributes.content: That's not the right attitude when you're asking for help...
attributes.name: Grain Buds

attributes.content: Say, Megaphone, I wanted to ask you something...
attributes.name: Grain Buds

attributes.content: You're a student at the Tianshi Bureaus, right? Out of all my friends, you know more than anyone else, except for Shu and Xiaohe...
attributes.name: Grain Buds

attributes.content: Well, what is it? Spit it out.
attributes.name: Annoyed Apprentice Tianshi

attributes.content: Have you... have you ever seen my parents?
attributes.name: Grain Buds

attributes.content: Pi hua! How many people do you think there are in the Tianshi Bureaus? You think I remember everyone who passes through the doors like the security guards?
attributes.name: Annoyed Apprentice Tianshi

attributes.content: Did the mud ball give you a concussion or something?
attributes.name: Annoyed Apprentice Tianshi

attributes.content: You could've just said you don't know them. No need to be rude.
attributes.name: Grain Buds

attributes.content: Why are you asking?
attributes.name: Annoyed Apprentice Tianshi

attributes.content: I saw a strange merchant today. He said he came from outside Dahuang, from very far away.
attributes.name: Grain Buds

attributes.content: Oh?
attributes.name: Annoyed Apprentice Tianshi

attributes.content: Shu said my parents went to become Tianshis in a faraway place, but I never knew what they did, or why they never came back after all these years. No one ever talked about it.
attributes.name: Grain Buds

attributes.content: Is there a chance you could ask for me, Megaphone?
attributes.name: Grain Buds

attributes.content: I'm not asking them to come back. I just want to write to them and tell them that Dahuang is about to get moved onto mobile plates, so they won't lose their way when they come home.
attributes.name: Grain Buds

attributes.content: ...Don't you worry. The Tianshi Bureaus aren't stupid. Someone will bring them home when it's time for them to come home.
attributes.name: Annoyed Apprentice Tianshi

attributes.content: Hm...
attributes.name: Grain Buds

attributes.content: Is this all the flood-affected plates?
attributes.name: Annoyed Apprentice Tianshi
Grain Buds
attributes.content: I think so...

attributes.name: Grain Buds
attributes.content: Why? Does the rice you're looking for have something to do with the flood?
Don't ask questions that don't concern you. You wouldn't understand the work of the Tianshi Bureaus, even if I explained it.
attributes.name: Annoyed Apprentice Tianshi

attributes.content: You just wait and see! Xiaohe said that with my talent for Arts, all I need to do is to read a few more books, and I'll get into the Tianshi Bureaus for sure! Then I'll wipe that cocky look off your face!
attributes.name: Grain Buds

attributes.content: Sure, sure. If and when you do.
attributes.name: Annoyed Apprentice Tianshi

attributes.content: And don't tell anyone that I asked you to look for the rice stalks.
attributes.name: Annoyed Apprentice Tianshi
Grain Buds
attributes.content: But why...?

attributes.name: Grain Buds
attributes.content: Forget it. You'll never say.
Hey... how have you been doing? Anyone bullying you?
attributes.name: Tianshi Apprentice

attributes.content: Me? I'm pretty happy. Shu and Xiaohe take care of me, and all the farmers around here are really nice. I also made two new friends, Candlestick and Inkbrush.
attributes.name: Grain Buds

attributes.content: Why do you ask? Are you worried about me?
attributes.name: Grain Buds

attributes.content: Worried about you? Of course not! Nope!
attributes.name: Tianshi Apprentice

attributes.content: Well, thanks for the help anyway. Take care of yourself.
attributes.name: Tianshi Apprentice

attributes.content: If anyone bullies you, smack them on the head with your flute like I taught you.
attributes.name: Tianshi Apprentice

attributes.content: Grow, flax, mulberry and fields, grow as the sun rises...
attributes.name: Ji

attributes.content: Drive away all evil, and bring new light to Heaven and earth...
attributes.name: Ji

attributes.content: Lalala... lalala...
attributes.name: Ji

attributes.content: I never liked this statue.
attributes.name: Ji

attributes.content: Who decided that Shennong should be shabby and weathered? She liked to look pretty. She always had flowers in her hair, and she liked the clothes I made.
attributes.name: Ji

attributes.content: And I remember how much her eyes looked like yours.
attributes.name: Ji

attributes.content: If only Dusk had a portrait of her... but that was before she started to paint.
attributes.name: Ji

attributes.content: I didn't think you would ever come back.
attributes.name: Shu

attributes.content: Come now, I'm already past the age for running away from home. When did I ever say I wouldn't come back?
attributes.name: Ji

attributes.content: The prodigal son starts to miss home when he's far away for long enough. And this is the one place that I felt like I could call home.
attributes.name: Ji

attributes.content: Now, though? At a time like this?
attributes.name: Shu

attributes.content: If only I came back two days earlier! I would've made it in time for this year's festival opera, and tasted your handmade dumplings.
attributes.name: Ji

attributes.content: Sure. 'Dumplings for the road, noodles for home.' Whatever you want to eat, we've got it at home.
attributes.name: Shu

attributes.content: Then, it's time for you to go.
attributes.name: Shu

attributes.content: I've hardly been back for two days, and you're already kicking me out?
attributes.name: Ji

attributes.content: You could stay for as long as you want, if you were only here to take a rest.
attributes.name: Shu

attributes.content: Are you only here to take a rest, though? That's what I want to ask.
attributes.name: Shu

attributes.content: Dahuang looks different every time I come back. Who would have thought that it was just a land of frozen soil a thousand years ago?
attributes.name: Ji

attributes.content: The people claimed this earth from a land of evil. Back then, the mountains and rivers were chaos, and the heavens knew no seasons, but hearts were brave and bright.
attributes.name: Ji

attributes.content: There were no differences in upbringing or nationality. Everyone looked out for one another. The only enemy was the barren soil before them, and the demonic threat that always loomed over their heads.
attributes.name: Ji

attributes.content: I dreamt of her a few days ago, and I dreamt of that old gentleman too. I thought maybe it was time I came home.
attributes.name: Ji

attributes.content: Fortunately, the way home was the same. Unfortunately, the same could not be said of people's hearts.
attributes.name: Ji

attributes.content: When was the last time you had a good look at the people here?
attributes.name: Shu

attributes.content: All under Heaven live for profit, and die for profit.
attributes.name: Ji

attributes.content: Where profit goes, so do the people. It's the same everywhere.
attributes.name: Ji

attributes.content: What do you think the imperial court spends its time discussing? How to protect our lives, or how to achieve an outcome that they believe to be safest?
attributes.name: Ji

attributes.content: Do you really think that Nian's toy can keep everyone safe?
attributes.name: Ji

attributes.content: It's the only way to save everyone's lives.
attributes.name: Shu

attributes.content: You're handing your life over to someone else.
attributes.name: Ji

attributes.content: It's not a fair partnership, if one side shoulders all the risk.
attributes.name: Ji

attributes.content: Both sides must bear the same risk, in order for the partnership to last.
attributes.name: Ji

attributes.content: Have you been away for so long that all you care about is profit and loss?
attributes.name: Shu

attributes.content: I care about you, my sister.
attributes.name: Ji

attributes.content: You're tired.
attributes.name: Ji

attributes.content: Helping out with Nian's project is incredibly taxing. As if you don't have enough on your plate already, in the fields and forests.
attributes.name: Ji

attributes.content: Otherwise, you would have noticed earlier.
attributes.name: Ji

attributes.content: How many Catastrophes have struck this land in the last thousand years? You knew when and where each and every one would strike beforehand. You feel everything that happens to this land, as though it was happening to you.
attributes.name: Ji

attributes.content: What are you holding onto?
attributes.name: Ji

attributes.content: Who's the one working against the laws of nature?
attributes.name: Ji

attributes.content: Wake up!
attributes.name: Zuo Le

attributes.content: What did you see?
attributes.name: Zuo Le

attributes.content: What did I see...?
attributes.name: He Sheng

attributes.content: I saw...
attributes.name: He Sheng

attributes.content: Wait... how did you know?
attributes.name: He Sheng

attributes.content: Zuo Le is holding a thread in his hand. It soon vanishes into thin air.
Maybe a practical joke... probably Originium Arts.
attributes.name: Zuo Le

attributes.content: What you saw was an illusion, but it was something that he wanted you to see. Some kind of psychological suggestion... what did you see?
attributes.name: Zuo Le

attributes.content: I saw an old farmer...
attributes.name: He Sheng

attributes.content: She... made me work the fields. I couldn't get any crops to grow. I grew old, and I couldn't lift the hoe anymore...
attributes.name: He Sheng

attributes.content: There were many placards on the trees across the river. No one ever went there, but there seemed to be names written on them... the old farmer disappeared.
attributes.name: He Sheng

attributes.content: Across the river?
attributes.name: Zuo Le

attributes.content: He showed you the other side of the river...
attributes.name: Zuo Le

attributes.content: He Sheng sighs and looks along the river into the distance.
The trees are green on the other side of the river. A gust of wind seems to rustle the leaves.
Xiaohe! Candlestick! There you are.
attributes.name: Grain Buds

attributes.content: Grain Buds! Where were you?
attributes.name: Zuo Le

attributes.content: I was looking for rice stalks...
attributes.name: Grain Buds

attributes.content: Rice? I thought you went looking for stockbeasts. What kind of rice was it that you had to look for?
attributes.name: He Sheng

attributes.content: I—
attributes.name: Grain Buds

attributes.content: And don't tell anyone that I asked you to look for the rice stalks.
attributes.name: Annoyed Apprentice Tianshi

attributes.content: I promised I wouldn't tell anyone...
attributes.name: Grain Buds

attributes.content: It's all so weird... I can't make heads or tails of it...
attributes.name: He Sheng

attributes.content: Who asked you to look for rice? What did it look like? Where did you find it?
attributes.name: Zuo Le

attributes.content: Candlestick? Wh-What's the matter? You're starting to scare me...
attributes.name: Grain Buds

attributes.content: Grain Buds!
attributes.name: Zuo Le

attributes.content: Alright, alright...
attributes.name: Grain Buds

attributes.content: It was a short little girl, a student at the Tianshi Bureaus, who said she was looking for a special kind of rice to submit for homework...
attributes.name: Grain Buds

attributes.content: I didn't know what species it was... it was red, really red. There were some at the dam, and in the paddies not far from there.
attributes.name: Grain Buds

attributes.content: He Sheng, where did they store the recently harvested grain?
attributes.name: Zuo Le

attributes.content: The centralized granaries in the core city.
attributes.name: He Sheng

attributes.content: I need you to check on the granaries right now. No delay. Report anything unusual to the Xiangzhang immediately.
attributes.name: Zuo Le

attributes.content: Wait, what's going on?
attributes.name: He Sheng

attributes.content: We might be too late already...
attributes.name: Zuo Le

attributes.content: Today, the celebration's opera comes in three acts: The Great Hunt, Signs of Heaven, and Flourishing Life.
attributes.name: Ji

attributes.content: But there used to be another act between the first and second: Pacifying the North. It hasn't been sung for a long, long time.
attributes.name: Ji

attributes.content: Do you remember, Shu? Can you sing another verse?
attributes.name: Ji

attributes.content: I still remember the tune, but not the words.
attributes.name: Shu

attributes.content: All old stories. Hardly worth a song.
attributes.name: Shu

attributes.content: Yes, hard to get in the mood when there's no audience.
attributes.name: Ji

attributes.content: And hard for the audience to get into a forgettable opera.
attributes.name: Ji

attributes.content: But I remember...
attributes.name: Ji

attributes.content: I remember this demonic fragment to the north is the result of the people at the time resorting to any means necessary to resist It. Now, Its incarnation is helping the people fend off demonic calamity. Fate works in mysterious ways, doesn't it?
attributes.name: Ji

attributes.content: We should not be conflated with It.
attributes.name: Shu

attributes.content: You're right. We shouldn't.
attributes.name: Ji

attributes.content: The people must never learn of the demonic presence. But how do you resist the lure of this one precious piece of unpolluted soil?
attributes.name: Ji

attributes.content: For a thousand years the people here have lived across the river from that blight. Here a people have sowed for a thousand years in blissful seclusion.
attributes.name: Ji

attributes.content: The time has come to reap what was sowed a thousand years ago. And it must be reaped by the right person.
attributes.name: Ji

attributes.content: Tell me... You didn't have anything to do with that disaster, did you?
attributes.name: Shu

attributes.content: I've never lied to you.
attributes.name: Ji

attributes.content: True. You just choose not to tell the truth, from time to time.
attributes.name: Shu

attributes.content: Why have you come back?
attributes.name: Shu

attributes.content: Like I said, I just felt like dropping by.
attributes.name: Ji

attributes.content: Just like old times, I want to ask: Will you come with me, sister?
attributes.name: Ji

attributes.content: My answer is the same. I will not leave. I can't leave.
attributes.name: Shu
